doc.field: Matters Attended To (Governor Sholtz and His World Trade Center Proposal) - oversize
Matters Attended To (Governor Sholtz and His World Trade Center Proposal) - oversize

Includes plans for the upper, street, and basement levels and a cross section of the World Trade Center. Plans labeled "World Trade Center, John and Drew Eberson - Architects, 2 West 47th Street, New York, NY, George A. Fuller Company - Builders, David Sholtz - President." Also includes an overview illustration of what the completed World Trade Center was envisioned to look like, memoranda dealing with the specifics of the plan, and a memo from Henry Wright to Grover recommending that the plan did warrant publication in the ARCHITECTURAL FORUM.
Series VI. Allen Grover Files >> Matters Attended To (Governor Sholtz and His World Trade Center Proposal) - oversize
